column4: What program can I use to extract the audio tracks from a music video dvd
i usually use handbrake to rip the video and then ffmpeg or mplayer to get the audio from that
can ffmpeg or mplayer get audio directly from dvd?
never tried so i can't say
if you can play the dvd in mplayer it can dump just the audio from it to a file
that's cool, but im not familiar with  mplayer... its command line, isn't it?
I see that ffmpeg can get the audio from a .mpg file and dump it as mp3.  Will it create a single mp3 file of all music on dvd?
like i said i've never done it that way so i don't know. i use ffmpeg to rip the audio from video files. even if it rips themm to separate files you could join them together.
I would prefer separate files, but either way...  I will give handbrake and ffmpeg a try thanks.
do you know if there is a 9.04 64 bit version?  only see 9.10 on site
it will probably work just fine, or you could compile from the sources
I think the .deb file is for 9.10, errors trying dpkg -i  need newer libraries than I have....
oh ok, then i guess you've gotta compile it
can't update to 9.10... problems with mouse/trackpad  prevent it with 9.10
